document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Viereck, H. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Viereck, H. L. (1912) Descriptions of five new genera and twenty six new species of Ichneumon-flies. Proceedings of the United States National Museum, 42, 139 - 153. https: // doi. org / 10.5479 / si. 00963801.42 - 1920.613

subSubSection.paragraph:
Apanteles homonae Rohwer, 1922: 53
; Leefmans, 1922: 57; Menzel, 1925: 115. Syn. by Wilkinson, 1928 .

Apanteles plusiae Viereck, 1913: 557
; Ayyar, 1920: 932; Ayyar, 1927: 74; Beeson & Chatterjee, 1935: 153; Gupa, 1957: 109. Syn. by Wilkinson, 1928 .

Diagnosis. Body length 2.7 mm , fore wing length 3.1 mm . Body black, hind femur blackish. Ocelli large, posterior tangent to anterior ocellus transecting posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus slightly shorter than diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna distinctly shorter than body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.5× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum not shorter than its diameter. Areola on propodeum open anteriorly, V-shaped apically, with strong costulae. Pterostigma 3.1× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.1× longer than pterostigma, vein r 1.5× longer than vein 2-SR, angled at junction. T1 nearly parallel-sided, 1.7× longer than hind width, turned-over part slightly shiny, unsculptured, longitudinal channel shallow, broad; T2 shiny and polished, 3.6× wider than long in the middle; T3 1.6× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath 3/4 length of hind tibia.

Hosts. According to the label,
Acleris fimbriana Thunberg
( Lepidoptera : Tortricidae ) and
Spilonota lechriaspis Meyrick
( Lepidoptera : Tortricidae ). According to literature,
Anadevidia peponis Fabricius
,
Bocchoris artificialis
,
Diaphania indica Sauders, D.
indica Sauders [
Trichosanthes anguina
],
G. molesta (Busck)
,
Homona coffearia (Nietner)
,
Maruca vitrata (Fabricius)
[
Cajanus cajan
],
Maruca vitrata (Fabricius)
[
Sesbania cannabina
],
Nephantis serinopa Myrick
(
Opisina arenosella
),
Nephantis serinopa Myrick
[
Cocos nucifera
],
Pleuroptya ruralis (Scopoli)
,
Pseudaletia unipuncta (Haworth)
,
Spilarctia obliqua (Walker)
and
Streblote dorsalis Moore
(
Yu et al . 2016
).
